revised_title: Observations of the Effects of an Earthquake on China Figures and a Porter
tldr: The author, Michael Russel, shares his observations of the effects of a violent earthquake on his house in Bloomsbury and the unusual movement of china figures on a cabinet. He also mentions the experience of a porter who was struck by a blast and fell down during the earthquake. Russel seeks the President's opinion on whether these observations are worthy of the Royal Society's attention.
